alert.note: Alert for Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 08 at 7:13PM EDT until September 08 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN LOUDOUN COUNTY... At 713 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding from thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported multiple roads closed with vehicles trapped over eastern Loudoun County. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Leesburg... South Riding... Broadlands... Lansdowne... Lowes Island... Brambleton... Dulles International Airport... Ashburn... Sterling... Countryside... Arcola... Belmont... Sterling Park... This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... Cochran Mill Road at Sycolin Creek, Evergreen Mills Road at Bluemont Ridge Road, Braddock Road near Route 15, Braddock Road near Gum Spring Road, Bull Run Post Office Road, Evergreen Mills Road at Arcola Road and Shreve Mill Road at Sycolin Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
